channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump official tells census workers Congress has final say over the count, not Trump
item.description: Days after the president's call for a "new" census, the top official overseeing the Census Bureau told employees that Congress, not Trump, has final say over the tally, NPR has exclusively learned.
item.content:encoded:
Days after the president's call for a "new" census, the top official overseeing the Census Bureau told employees that Congress, not Trump, has final say over the tally, NPR has exclusively learned.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: Syria Tries To Rebuild A Functioning Economy After Years of Corrupt Dictatorship
item.description: Syria’s trying to emerge from a multi-layered financial crisis since opposition fighters toppled the regime late last year and formed a government. It’s been given a boost by the US lifting most sanctions, but efforts are hampered by a lack of liquidity.
item.content:encoded: Syria’s trying to emerge from a multi-layered financial crisis since opposition fighters toppled the regime late last year and formed a government. It’s been given a boost by the US lifting most sanctions, but efforts are hampered by a lack of liquidity.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: State Department slashes its annual reports on human rights
item.description: Required by Congress, the reports no longer single out things like rigged elections or sexual violence against children as human rights violations.
item.content:encoded: Required by Congress, the reports no longer single out things like rigged elections or sexual violence against children as human rights violations.
item.dc:creator: Graham Smith

item.title: Tropical Storm Erin could become the first Atlantic hurricane of the 2025 season
item.description: The National Hurricane Center expects the storm to strengthen over the next several days and says it could become a hurricane by late Thursday.
item.content:encoded: The National Hurricane Center expects the storm to strengthen over the next several days and says it could become a hurricane by late Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: D.C. has been under tighter federal control before. Here's what it looked like
item.description: Trump's expansion of federal authority over Washington, D.C., is in many ways unprecedented, but calls to mind other times the city has been under tighter federal control.
item.content:encoded:
Trump's expansion of federal authority over Washington, D.C., is in many ways unprecedented, but calls to mind other times the city has been under tighter federal control.

(Image credit: National Archives)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Taylor Swift announces her next era: 'The Life of a Showgirl'
item.description: After cryptic Instagram posts and a surprise countdown clock, Swift announced early Tuesday that her new album will be called The Life of a Showgirl. The cover art and release date remain a mystery.
item.content:encoded:
After cryptic Instagram posts and a surprise countdown clock, Swift announced early Tuesday that her new album will be called The Life of a Showgirl. The cover art and release date remain a mystery.

(Image credit: Emma McIntyre)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: The hidden costs of cutting Medicaid
item.description: Cutting Medicaid can seem like an easy way to slash the budget. But, the costs can spread to all of us.
item.content:encoded: Cutting Medicaid can seem like an easy way to slash the budget. But, the costs can spread to all of us.
item.dc:creator: Emily Crawford

item.title: Inflation remains elevated as Trump's tariffs take hold
item.description: Inflation remained elevated last month as President Trump's tariffs continued to make their way into the prices that consumers pay. The average cost of living in July was up 2.7%.
item.content:encoded:
Inflation remained elevated last month as President Trump's tariffs continued to make their way into the prices that consumers pay. The average cost of living in July was up 2.7%.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: D.C. residents express concern over crime crackdown. And, Ford invests big in EVs
item.description: Washington, D.C., residents express concerns over what Trump's crime crackdown could mean for them. And, Ford plans to invest billions in building a new, cheaper electric truck
item.content:encoded:
Washington, D.C., residents express concerns over what Trump's crime crackdown could mean for them. And, Ford plans to invest billions in building a new, cheaper electric truck

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Why lung cancer is a 'hidden epidemic' in this part of the world
item.description: Rates of the world's deadliest cancer appear to be low in sub-Saharan Africa. But that statistic is masking the scope of the disease, doctors say.
item.content:encoded: Rates of the world's deadliest cancer appear to be low in sub-Saharan Africa. But that statistic is masking the scope of the disease, doctors say.
item.dc:creator: Simar Bajaj
